bestBHT.bht: Those who do the will of God become part of the family of Jesus Christ, their spiritual bond with him even stronger than that of his earthly relatives. This highlights the deep love and affection that Christ has for his followers, demonstrating that he is not ashamed to be associated with them. Furthermore, it implies that harm done to believers will not go unnoticed or unpunished by Christ.

John Gill: Such are openly, and manifestly related to Christ in a spiritual sense; and are as dear to him, and more so, than such persons are who stand in such a relation to others, or did to him according to the flesh."
And this shows not only the near relation, and strong affection which Christ has for his people, but that he is not ashamed of them.
It may be concluded, that he will resent, in the keenest manner, every injury that is done them.

bhtAttempts.bht: Believers who do the will of God are considered spiritual family to Jesus, even closer to Him than His own earthly family. This demonstrates Christ's deep love and strong attachment to His followers. He takes great pride in His relationship with them, unashamed to identify Himself with them. Any harm done to them will not go unnoticed, as Jesus will fiercely defend and avenge them against their enemies.

Those who fulfill God's will are esteemed by Jesus as spiritual kin, surpassing even His own fleshly relatives in their intimate connection to Him. This reveals the profound affection and unshakable bond that Christ holds for His disciples. He bears no shame in being associated with them; rather, He takes immense delight in their fellowship. Any injustice inflicted upon them will not be taken lightly, as Jesus will vigorously confront and retaliate against those who harm His beloved.

Believers who are spiritually united with Christ are cherished by Him even more than His earthly family. This illustrates His deep love and affection for His followers, as He never shies away from being associated with them. Any harm inflicted upon believers will be met with the utmost seriousness, as Jesus passionately protects and defends those who belong to Him.

Those who do the will of God become part of the family of Jesus Christ, their spiritual bond with him even stronger than that of his earthly relatives. This highlights the deep love and affection that Christ has for his followers, demonstrating that he is not ashamed to be associated with them. Furthermore, it implies that harm done to believers will not go unnoticed or unpunished by Christ.

Believers who do the will of God are considered family by Jesus. They have a spiritual connection with him that is even stronger than physical relationships. This demonstrates the deep love and affection Christ has for his followers. He is not ashamed of them but takes great pride in their relationship. Anyone who harms these believers can expect severe consequences from Jesus, for he fiercely protects and defends them.
